content: work p1 k1 for 12 16 rnds bobble in rib patt fold over for thumb cuff fasten_off rem sts leaving an 18 45 5 cm tail option 3 - closed thumb work k1 p1 for 12 16 rnds then ssk around fasten_off rem 5 6 sts 3 © 2024 leila raven for personal use only finishing weave in ends and block excluding long tail for pop- top version continue below mitt - pop top turn mitten top inside out and draw yarn tail through center on the ws create twisted cord loop thread yarn tail onto tapestry needle and draw up through center of closed top again leaving a long loop approx the same length as the end with needle three strands approx 6 15 cm each set tapestry needle aside twist cord cut loop in half then take each end and twist in the same direction of the yarn plies s twist or clockwise to introduce even more twist to the yarn continue building up twist in this way until just before the yarn starts looping back on itself then take both ends and twist them together in the opposite direction z twist or counter-clockwise creating a plied cord tie an overhand knot at the end of the cord to keep the two ends from untwisting sew button fold the mitten top inside out and lay flat against the back of the hand to note where button should be placed with sewing thread or spare yarn if sturdy enough sew button securely to back of mitt make cord loop create a loop with the cord using the button placement to measure how much length will be needed for the loop pinch the loop together at the base of the inside-out pop top and taking the third strand of yarn wrap the base of the loop thread yarn onto tapestry needle and weave end through from the top of wrap down through the bottom end of the wrapped loop and secure to center of pop top tie the cord and yarn end off with a firm knot to secure and weave in ends invisibly remember the pop top is ws out when buttoned back and rs out when worn closed 4 © 2024 leila raven for personal use only
